sentences.english: During the depression, I used to hop freights at least once a month.

sentences.english: Some have to hide eking out a living for decades.

sentences.english: I have friends who, I suspect, secretly scoff at my mild work-out routines.

sentences.english: He slunk into his parent's room and took the car keys.

sentences.english: You sneak a flask up there and raise a toast to the whole city of New York.

sentences.english: On it came-on, silently and stealthily, to the bed's head.

sentences.english: Sometimes a coot will try and sneak one of its eggs into a neighbor's nest.

sentences.english: LIFE】A Chinese tourist steals a glimpse of the Palace Museum inside Beijing’s Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 一位遊客偷偷張望北京紫禁城內的故宮博物館。

definition: to peep/to peek/to steal a glance
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
cautious and solemn (idiom); very carefully/prudent/gently and cautiously
midnight/in the middle of the night
